# 5 Forces

## 5.6 Forces and motion

### 5.6.1.5 Acceleration and velocity-time graphs

---

<!-- _class: objectives -->

![bg left:15%](https://d193ppza2qrruo.cloudfront.net/production/images/motorway_driving.jpg)

## 5.6.1.5 Acceleration and velocity-time graphs

- Calculate average acceleration using $a=\frac{\Delta v}{\Delta t}$
- Deceleration is slowing down
- Estimate the magnitude of everyday accelerations
- Calculate acceleration from the gradient of a velocity-time graph
- (HT) Calculate distance or displacement from the enclosed area of a velocity-time graph
- Use the equation for uniform acceleration $v^2 = u^2 + 2as$
- State the acceleration due to gravity as 9.8 m/s$^2$

---

![bg left:15%](https://d193ppza2qrruo.cloudfront.net/production/images/motorway_driving.jpg)

# Starter challenge

A car accelerates from 13 m/s to 26 m/s (roughly 30mph to 60mph) at an acceleration of 3 m/s$^2$.

**Calculate** the distance travelled by the car.

_hint: try sketching a graph._

Extension: can you generalise?

## <!-- The answer is 76m. -->

---

![bg left:15%](https://d193ppza2qrruo.cloudfront.net/production/images/motorway_driving.jpg)

_<!-- _class: justify-content-start -->_

1. A car begins at a speed of **3 m/s** and accelerates at **2m/s$^2$** over a distance of **40m**, calculate the final speed of the car.

## Worked Solution

$$
\begin{aligned}
v^2 &= u^2 + 2as \\
v^2 &= (3)^2 + 2(2)(40) \\
v^2 &= \sqrt{169} \\
v &= 13 \text{ m/s}
\end{aligned}
$$

---

_<!-- _class: justify-content-start -->_

![bg left:15%](https://health.clevelandclinic.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/07/fasterRunner-656983165-770x533-1-650x428.jpg)

2. A runner reaches a speed of 3m/s after accelerating at 2.25m/s$^2$ whilst travelling a distance of 2m, calculate the initial speed of the runner.

---

<!-- _class: justify-content-start -->

![bg right:20%](data:image/jpeg;base64,)

3. A bicycle accelerates from rest to 6m/s in a distance of 50m, calculate the acceleration.

---

<!-- _class: justify-content-start -->

![bg left:15%](https://www.stockvault.net/data/2016/03/23/189727/preview16.jpg)

4. A person who is initially stationary is eventually walking at a speed of 1.5m/s after an acceleration of 0.5 m/s$^2$, calculate the distance it takes them to reach this speed.

---

# Copy and complete

5. A car reaches a speed of 15m/s after an acceleration of 2m/s$^2$ over a distance of 44m, calculate the initial speed.
6. A motorbike reaches a speed of 20m/s over 60m, whilst accelerating at 3m/s$^2$, determine the bike’s initial speed.
7. A person begins moving after initially being stationary, the person accelerates at 0.5m/s$^2$ over a distance of 9m, what is their final speed?
8. A lorry pulls forward after initially being stationary, it takes the lorry 40m to reach a speed of 8m/s, calculate the lorry’s acceleration.
9. A child travels down a slide, at the top the child is initially at rest, at the bottom the child is travelling at a speed of 3m/s, the child’s acceleration is 1m/s$^2$, how long is the slide?

### Make up 3 questions yourself.

---

# Answers

1. 13 m/s
2. 0 m/s
3. 0.36 m/s$^2$
4. 2.25 m
5. 7 m/s
6. 6.32 m/s
7. 3 m/s
8. 0.8 m/s$^2$
9. 4.5 m
